channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Silicon Valley spooks the AI safety advocates
item.description: The White House's David Sacks and OpenAI's Jason Kwon caused a stir online this week for their comments about groups promoting AI safety.

item.title: The Biggest Fall Deals at Home Depot (2025)
item.description: This fall, The Home Depot cut prices on bedding, cutlery, rugs, and Milwaukee power tools. Here’s where to find the biggest deals.

item.title: Your AI tools run on fracked gas and bulldozed Texas land
item.description: If you're wondering why AI companies are pursuing this path, they'll tell you it's not just about electricity — it's about beating China.

item.title: Best Indoor Garden Systems: We've Been Testing All Year (2025)
item.description: Grow a backyard’s worth of greens and vegetables in your house with a vertical hydroponic garden. Here are a few that might be worth the investment.

item.title: Some of Our Favorite Noise-Canceling Headphones Are $100 Off if You Act Fast
item.description: The Bose QuietComfort Ultra get a rare discount until the end of the day.

item.title: Can AI Avoid the Enshittification Trap?
item.description: Cory Doctorow’s theory of “enshittification” explains how tech platforms rot from within. As AI grows more profitable—and powerful—it risks the same f...

item.title: Trump DOE decides to keep at least one Biden-era energy program
item.description: The loan guarantee will backstop $1.6 billion for AEP, one of the nation's largest utilities, as it seeks to modernize a portion of its transmissions ...

item.title: Senate Republicans deepfaked Chuck Schumer, and X hasn’t taken it down
item.description: The video was posted Friday on the Senate Republicans' X account. According to X’s policies, the platform prohibits “deceptively shar[ing] synthetic o...

item.title: Elon Musk Has Turned His Eye to the UK
item.description: Musk posted nonstop at the beginning of the year about British politics, until his focus was consumed by DOGE. Now he’s back.

item.title: Should AI do everything? OpenAI thinks so
item.description: Silicon Valley’s rule? It’s not cool to be cautious. As OpenAI removes guardrails and VCs criticize companies like Anthropic for supporting AI safety ...
